ua.khpi.hrynevych.task03.subtask02

Class Subtask02

  • java.lang.Object
    • ua.khpi.hrynevych.task03.subtask02.Subtask02

  • public final class Subtask02
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods for text analysis. There are methods extracting words of minimum and maximum length and also some additional methods.
    Version:
    1.0, 17 Nov 2017
    Author:
    Hrynevych Pavlo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private Subtask02()
      The utility class can't have instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      Returns the length of the largest word in the input array.

      Returns list of the largest words from the input text.

      Returns the length of the smallest word in the input array.

      Returns list of the smallest words from the input text.
      static java.lang.String[] getWords(java.lang.String text)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Subtask02

        private Subtask02()
        The utility class can't have instances.

    • Method Detail

      • getWords

        public static java.lang.String[] getWords(java.lang.String text)
        Extracts words from the text in input. Assumed that word is a sequence of characters containing only letters. If word appears in the text more than once - resulting array will contain only one sample of such word.
        Parameters:
        text - input text
        Returns:
        array of words of the text, which is empty if text contains no words

      • getMinLength

        public static int getMinLength(java.lang.String[] words)
        Returns the length of the smallest word in the input array. Returns 0 if the input array is empty. In fact method returns length of the smallest string in the array, so if it contains empty string (which is not actually a word) result also will be 0.
        Parameters:
        words - array containing words
        Returns:
        length of the smallest word in array

      • getMinWords

        public static java.lang.String getMinWords(java.lang.String text)
        Returns list of the smallest words from the input text. Format of output is as follows: prefix "Min: " which is followed by the comma-separated words of minimum length from the text. Output contains only one sample of each word, even if such word appears in the text twice or more. If text contains no words then only prefix is returned.
        Parameters:
        text - input text
        Returns:
        list of the smallest words in specified format

      • getMaxLength

        public static int getMaxLength(java.lang.String[] words)
        Returns the length of the largest word in the input array. Returns 0 if the input array is empty. In fact method returns length of the largest string in the array, so if it contains only empty strings (which are not actually words) result also will be 0.
        Parameters:
        words - array containing words
        Returns:
        length of the largest word in array

      • getMaxWords

        public static java.lang.String getMaxWords(java.lang.String text)
        Returns list of the largest words from the input text. Format of output is as follows: prefix "Max: " which is followed by the comma-separated words of maximum length from the text. Output contains only one sample of each word, even if such word appears in the text twice or more. If text contains no words then only prefix is returned.
        Parameters:
        text - input text
        Returns:
        list of the largest words in specified format
